#----- EDA Libraries -------
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
import missingno as mn
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")
source.aed7cd0e:
# Dropping some of the features

data.drop(['Unnamed: 0','ID','Photo','Flag','Club Logo'],axis = 1, inplace = True)
source.21502a1c:
# We will drop all the rows having less than or equal to 10 percent missing values
var1 = [ 'LS', 'ST', 'RS', 'LW',
       'LF', 'CF', 'RF', 'RW', 'LAM', 'CAM', 'RAM', 'LM', 'LCM', 'CM', 'RCM',
       'RM', 'LWB', 'LDM', 'CDM', 'RDM', 'RWB', 'LB', 'LCB', 'CB', 'RCB', 'RB']
data.dropna(axis = 0, subset= var1,inplace = True)
source.83c0bd9e:
var2 = ['Club','Contract Valid Until','Release Clause','Joined']
data.dropna(axis = 0 , subset=var2,inplace = True)
source.7058bf97:
# Dropping the entire column of Loaned From as it has 93 percent approx missing values
data.drop(['Loaned From'],axis = 1,inplace = True)
source.2b28d0cf:
# Checking for any missing value in the data
data.isnull().sum().any()
source.d06fda08:
# Shape after removing rows and columns
data.shape
source.59ca947b:
nation_10_player = data['Nationality'].value_counts()[:11]
nation_10_player.plot.bar()
plt.title('Top 10 countries with most number of players in FIFA')
plt.xlabel('Country')
plt.ylabel('Number of players')
source.1e29e112:
# Top 20 countries with the most young players
nation_10_age = data.groupby(['Nationality'])['Age'].mean().sort_values(ascending = True)[:20]
nation_10_age.plot.bar(figsize = (15,12))
plt.title('Top 20 countries with most young players')
plt.xlabel('Country')
plt.ylabel('Age')
source.83db9c77:
# Top 11 players under 25 years of age with best 'Overall' 
young_best_overall = data[data['Age'] <= 25][:12]
young_best_overall[['Name','Overall','Age']]
source.dc2cdbe6:

plt.title('Player under 25 years of age with best Overall rating')
ax = sns.barplot(x = 'Name' , y = 'Overall', data = young_best_overall)
source.b27e7fd9:
# Top 10 teams to pick if your playing a crucial match
top_club_potential = data.groupby('Club')['Potential'].mean().sort_values(ascending = False)[:11]
top_club_potential.plot.bar()
plt.xlabel('Club')
plt.ylabel('Potential')

source.82d866b5:
# Top 10 nation that pays their players well
top_paid_nation = data.groupby(['Nationality'])['Wage'].mean().sort_values(ascending = False)[:11]
top_paid_nation.plot.bar()
plt.title('Top 10 nation that pays their players well')
plt.ylabel('Wage')
source.2d9276c5:
# Histogram dipicting the distribution of age among players
x = data.Age
sns.set(style ="dark", palette="colorblind", color_codes=True)
ax = sns.distplot(x,bins = 58,color = 'g',kde = False)
ax.set_xlabel('Age')
ax.set_ylabel('Number of players')

data['Preferred Foot'].value_counts().plot.pie()
source.09a3663e:
# Top 10 right footer players

best_right_footer = right_footer[['Name','Overall']].sort_values(by = 'Overall',ascending = False)
best_right_footer[:11]
source.84638be5:
# Top 10 left footer players

best_left_footer[:11]
source.e5aabf77:
# Box plot to find whether left footer have better 'Overall' or right footer
sns.boxplot(x = data['Preferred Foot'], y = data['Overall'], data = data)
source.220dcb6d:

source.b8add4a4:
# Boxplot dipicting the crossing ability of left and right footer
sns.boxplot(x = data['Preferred Foot'], y = data['Crossing'], data = data)
